body_html:
So, I guess what we can do is start adding the annotations, even if we're not relying on them (because we're still exporting all symbols). We can even add a non-blocking CI job to test what linker errors we get when we compile without exporting everything. Then eventually that job will be clean and we can flip it globally.

This depends on how soon you want CUDA 8 to work. It seems fairly reasonable to me though.

body:
So, I guess what we can do is start adding the annotations, even if we're not relying on them (because we're still exporting all symbols). We can even add a non-blocking CI job to test what linker errors we get when we compile without exporting everything. Then eventually that job will be clean and we can flip it globally.

This depends on how soon you want CUDA 8 to work. It seems fairly reasonable to me though.
